title: Trigonometric Functions - Rewriting and Solving - Part B

content.question: Part B The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>j</mn> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>k</mn> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4180@</annotation> </semantics> </math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@443B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) Solve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>3</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EBE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C4D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (ii) Solve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ECF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>k</mn> </math>.

frqParts.text: Part B The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>j</mn> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>k</mn> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4180@</annotation> </semantics> </math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@443B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) Solve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>3</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EBE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C4D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (ii) Solve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ECF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>k</mn> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
